title: Seven die in coach plunge horror in Spain
description: The body of a woman is found two days after a bus falls from a bridge into a river in the Galicia region.

title: Dungannon Road: Three dead and five injured after crash near Cookstown
description: A woman and four children have also been taken to hospital after two cars collided on the Dungannon Road.

title: Premier League returns: Arsenal extend lead, Southampton bottom, pressure grows on bosses
description: Premier League football resumes with a feast of Boxing Day fixtures which produces 25 goals, as table-toppers Arsenal show no signs of letting up.

title: 'IVF let me introduce baby to my terminally-ill dad'
description: A terminally-ill father was able to meet his first grandchild after his daughter had IVF treatment.

title: Chelsea: Reece James in 'good place' after missing World Cup, says Blues boss Graham Potter
description: Chelsea right-back Reece James is in a "good place" after the "challenging period" of missing out on the World Cup, says boss Graham Potter.

title: Stefan Bajcetic: The 'cheeky' teenager and his 'Christmas story'
description: Jurgen Klopp says Stefan Bajcetic's goal for Liverpool was "like a Christmas story" after their win at Aston Villa.

title: Arsenal 3-1 West Ham United: Premier League leaders extend advantage to seven points
description: Arsenal underline their title credentials by fighting back to beat West Ham as they move seven points clear at the top of the Premier League.

title: Wallasey pub shooting: Arrests made over Christmas Eve pub shooting
description: Two people arrested after Elle Edwards killed in Christmas Eve pub shooting in Merseyside

title: Cody Gakpo: Liverpool in advanced talks to sign forward from PSV Eindhoven
description: Liverpool are in advanced talks to sign Dutch forward Cody Gakpo from PSV Eindhoven.

title: Wolves' victory at Everton 'only one step' towards survival - Julen Lopetegui
description: Wolves' win over fellow strugglers Everton is "only one step" on the path to Premier League survival, says manager Julen Lopetegui.

title: Iran protests: Family of football legend Ali Daei stopped from leaving
description: The wife and daughter of Ali Daei, who has backed protesters, are taken off a flight out of Iran.

title: Do not reduce UK's modern slavery protections, Theresa May warns
description: The former PM tells the BBC that Rishi Sunak should avoid creating new loopholes for criminal gangs.

title: Leicester City 0-3 Newcastle: Eddie Howe allowing Magpies fans to 'dream'
description: Eddie Howe may allow the Newcastle fans to let their imaginations run wild, but he is remaining grounded for now.

title: United Rugby Championship: Ospreys 34-14 Scarlets - Home side make extra man tell
description: Ospreys defeat 14-man Scarlets 34-14 in the United Rugby Championship after Argentina flanker Tomas Lezana is shown a fifth-minute red card.

title: Aston Villa 1-3 Liverpool: Reds make winning start to Premier League top-four bid
description: Liverpool make a winning return to Premier League action as they restart their bid to force their way into the Premier League's top four with victory over Aston Villa.

title: Leicester City 0-3 Newcastle: Newcastle can do anything this season - Howe
description: Newcastle boss Eddie Howe is delighted with his team's excellent first-half display as they beat Leicester 3-0 to move up to second in the Premier League.

title: Blackpool fire crews tackle blaze near Promenade
description: Eight fire engines were sent to the scene and a building has partially collapsed due to the fire.

title: Stars' tributes after death of actor Ronan Vibert
description: Kathy Burke and Richard E Grant are among the celebrity names remembering Ronan Vibert.

title: Everton 1-2 Wolves: Julen Lopetegui praises his side's mentality after victory
description: New Wolves manager Julen Lopetegui praises his side's "mentality" as Rayan Ait-Nouri scores a dramatic stoppage-time winner to secure a 2-1 win against Everton at Goodison Park.

title: Harry Kane: Tottenham striker can be 'number one in world', says Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg
description: Harry Kane is a "machine" who can be "number one in the world" after he showed no signs of a World Cup hangover as Tottenham drew at Brentford.

title: Cromer Boxing Day dip makes return after two-year break
description: Hundreds brave the North Sea as the Cromer dip makes a welcome comeback.

title: Everton 1-2 Wolverhampton Wanderers: Dramatic late winner for visitors
description: Rayan Ait-Nouri scores a dramatic stoppage-time winner as Wolves come from behind to win at fellow strugglers Everton.

title: Leicester City 0-3 Newcastle: Magpies move up to second after emphatic win
description: Newcastle United cruise past Leicester City to claim a sixth consecutive Premier League win and move up to second in the table.

title: Crystal Palace 0-3 Fulham: Cottagers put nine-man Palace to the sword
description: Goals from Bobby de Cordova-Reid, Tim Ream and Aleksandar Mitrovic inspire Fulham to victory over nine-man Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park.

title: Brentford 2-2 Tottenham: Thomas Frank praises Ivan Toney as 'constant threat' for Bees
description: Brentford boss Thomas Frank is very impressed with striker Ivan Toney, who was a "constant threat" in their 2-2 draw with Tottenham.

title: China to end Covid quarantine for foreign arrivals
description: The measure, to take effect from 8 January, is part of China's about-turn on its zero-Covid policy.

title: United Rugby Championship: Dragons 24-29 Cardiff - Visitors snatch last-gasp win
description: Corey Domachowski is the unlikely match-winner after snatching a dramatic last-gasp victory at Rodney Parade.

title: The far-right faithfuls not giving up
description: With only days to go until Lula is sworn in as president, some of his opponents refuse to accept defeat.

title: Buffalo blizzard: Storm turns city into 'war zone'
description: Dozens of deaths are now linked to a fearsome winter storm blanketing much of the US and Canada.

title: Brentford 2-2 Tottenham: Harry Kane scores as Spurs fight back from two goals down to draw
description: England captain Harry Kane scores in the first Premier League match since the World Cup as Tottenham fight back from 2-0 down to draw with Brentford.

title: Wallasey pub shooting: Christmas Eve attack victim named
description: Elle Edwards, 26, sustained head injuries when a gunman opened fire at the pub in Merseyside.

title: Welsh Water: Supply failings after homes left without water over Christmas
description: Welsh Water admits it should have done better as households remain without water on Boxing Day.

title: Sunken Jersey fishing boat bodies identified
description: Larry Simyunn and Jervis Baligat were working as crewmen on the L'Ecume II when it sank.

title: Craig Gordon: Hearts confirm Scotland goalkeeper's season has ended after leg break
description: Scotland goalkeeper Craig Gordon will miss the rest of the season after a double leg break, Heart of Midlothian confirm.

title: Official white Christmas but more snow to come
description: The Met Office has confirmed snow fell in parts of Scotland on 25 December as weather warnings were extended.

title: King's first Christmas message tops 10m viewers
description: The 10.7 million who saw King Charles's message compares with 8.96 million who watched the Queen a year ago.

title: Australia v South Africa: Cameron Green takes five wickets on day one of second Test
description: Cameron Green takes five wickets for Australia on day one of the second Test against South Africa, just days after landing a lucrative contract in the Indian Premier League.

title: Jude Bellingham: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp praises 'exceptional' player
description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp describes England midfielder Jude Bellingham as "exceptional".

title: Migrants: Ninety people cross Channel on Christmas Day
description: More than 45,000 migrants have made the perilous crossing from France to England so far this year

title: NFL: Tampa Bay beat Arizona in overtime despite Tom Brady struggles
description: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers keep their NFL play-off hopes in their own hands by beating the Arizona Cardinals in overtime.

title: Jersey flats explosion: Tenth person injured dies
description: Kathleen McGinness, 73, lived in a building next to the flats which exploded.

title: Welsh Rugby Union sanctions 12-a-side club matches to fulfil fixtures
description: The Welsh Rugby Union tells its clubs they can play matches with 12 players to fulfil fixtures.

title: South Korea accuses North of drone provocation
description: "Unmanned aerial vehicles" violated South Korean airspace, say the country's joint chiefs of staff.

title: China stages big military incursion, Taiwan says
description: More than 70 fighter jets and drones crossed into its air defence zone, the defence ministry says.

title: John Bateman: England second-rower leaves Wigan to join Wests Tigers
description: Wigan Warriors and England second row John Bateman leaves the club to join Wests Tigers in Australia's NRL.

title: Shoppers set to cut spending at Boxing Day sales
description: The rising cost of living is expected to curb the appetite for post-Christmas bargain-hunting.

title: Wolves sign Matheus Cunha on an initial loan from Atletico Madrid
description: Wolves sign Brazil forward Matheus Cunha on an initial loan deal from Atletico Madrid.

title: Ben Stokes: England Test captain discusses the future of cricket with Lord Botham
description: Ben Stokes speaks to Lord Botham about transforming Test cricket, their heroics at Headingley and opening up about mental health.

title: Ukraine war: Drone attack on Russian bomber base leaves three dead
description: Moscow says three service personnel died in a new drone attack on the base at Engels.

title: UK Covid modelling data to stop being published
description: The UK Health Security Agency says it will halt publishing the figures from early January.

title: Fox hunting: Fresh demands to toughen laws ahead of hundreds of meets
description: Using dogs to chase or kill foxes was made illegal in England and Wales in the Hunting Act 2004.

title: Rohingya refugees reach Indonesia after month at sea
description: A group of nearly 60 hungry and weak men are found in Aceh province after their boat drifts ashore.

title: Golfing great Kathy Whitworth dies at 83
description: During her long career, the American captured 88 professional titles - more than any other golfer.

title: Five ways sequins add to plastic pollution
description: Sequins are nearly always made of plastic and will take hundreds of years or more to decompose.

title: 10 years after UK's first hand transplant, patient and surgeon meet again
description: A decade on from the UK's first hand transplant, a Leeds patient and his surgeon tell their story.

title: Mark Easton's Boxing Day family puzzler 2022
description: This is the festive quiz in which no-one is expected to know any of the answers.

title: Quiz of the Year, part four: Who clinked glasses at a state banquet?
description: How well do you remember the news of the past 12 months?

title: Ukraine war: My nights are peaceful at last, after trauma of air raids
description: Nika survived the Russian assault on Kharkiv earlier this year, and is now settled in the UK.

title: Army of islanders to protect gecko the size of a paperclip
description: Locals on Union Island are trained to ensure a diminutive reptile does not get wiped out by poachers.

title: Seán Rooney: Arrest made after Irish soldier killed in Lebanon
description: Pte Seán Rooney is the first Irish soldier to be killed on UN deployment in Lebanon for 20 years.

title: TV lookahead: 23 highlights to look out for in 2023
description: Doctor Who, a 007 global contest and the return of Waterloo Road are among next year's TV treats.

title: How astronauts inspired the creation of Teletubbies
description: Anne Wood tells the story of how she created the Teletubbies.

title: Iran protests: 'No going back' as unrest hits 100 days
description: Anger swells despite a fierce crackdown as the regime faces its biggest challenge in decades.

title: Water pipe robots could stop billions of litres leaking
description: About 20% of our water supply is lost to leaks and scientists say miniature 'pipe robots' could help.

title: Leak-hunting 'pipebots' will help us save water
description: About 20% of our water supply is lost to leaks and scientists say miniature 'pipe robots' could help.
